title: How to Make a Paper Ninja Star (Shuriken)

steps.title: Get or cut 8 equally sized square sheets of paper.
steps.content: Get or cut 8 equally sized square sheets of paper. These will form the basic components of the transforming ninja star. The larger the square sheets are, the larger your ninja star will be. A good size is around the size of standard sticky notes. Sticky notes will work, but there is a specific way to fold the modules so that the adhesive portion doesn't get in the way.

steps.title: Grab one of the 8 square pieces to focus on to make the first module.
steps.content: Grab one of the 8 square pieces to focus on to make the first module. If using sticky notes, having the adhesive side on the back will make folding easier and the added grip can be helpful in making more precise folds.

steps.title: Fold the paper diagonally from one end to the other to form a right triangle.
steps.content: Fold the paper diagonally from one end to the other to form a right triangle. Repeat with the other side to form an X in the middle of the paper. Fold the paper in half on one side and open it back up. You should have an X with one horizontal line through it made from the creases. If using sticky notes, make sure the vertical line goes through the adhesive.

steps.title: Position the paper so the middle straight line is vertical.
steps.content: Position the paper so the middle straight line is vertical. Fold the corners to the middle of the cross along the vertical line. If using sticky notes, make sure you fold in on the side with the adhesive so the sticky portion is no longer showing.

steps.title: Fold the whole paper in half along the vertical line.
steps.content: Fold the whole paper in half along the vertical line.

steps.title: Push the square end into itself to form a rhombus shape with 2 back flaps.
steps.content: Push the square end into itself to form a rhombus shape with 2 back flaps. This is the finished base module.

steps.title: Following the same steps from 3-7, make 7 more of the base modules using the other pieces of paper.
steps.content: Following the same steps from 3-7, make 7 more of the base modules using the other pieces of paper.

steps.title: Grab 2 modules and put one end into the other as pictured above.
steps.content: Grab 2 modules and put one end into the other as pictured above. The closed front of one piece should be positioned in between the back flaps of the first piece. This forms the beginning of the chain.

steps.title: Fold the pointed edges that hang over the crevice of the second module (but not over the other edge) and unfold the paper to form a crease.
steps.content: Fold the pointed edges that hang over the crevice of the second module (but not over the other edge) and unfold the paper to form a crease. Do the same thing with the other side's pointed edge.

steps.title: Push both edges into the crevice of the second module to interlock the pieces and allow for a sliding motion between them.
steps.content: Push both edges into the crevice of the second module to interlock the pieces and allow for a sliding motion between them.

steps.title: Follow the above steps with the first 6 module pieces.
steps.content: Follow the above steps with the first 6 module pieces. The 7th and 8th modules are a little trickier because the pieces begin to overlap, but still follow the same concept. When adding the 7th piece, make sure the front of the first piece is in-between the back flaps of the 7th piece. Slide the 8th piece into place, following the same pattern as the rest of the pieces with the front of the piece fitting in-between the 2 folded-in edges of the 7th piece and back flaps on either side of the first piece. When folding the flaps back edges in, you will notice that there is already another piece in the way. Fold the flaps in on either side of the piece already in the crevice, by holding the middle piece to the side while folding the edges in on either side. Do this with both the edges of the 7th piece as well as the edges of the 8th piece. You should now have a fully interlocked octagonal shape. This is the untransformed version of the ninja star.

steps.title: Grabbing opposite sides of the octagon, push inward toward the center of the octagon, allowing the pieces to slide against each other and reveal the “blades” of the ninja star.
steps.content: Grabbing opposite sides of the octagon, push inward toward the center of the octagon, allowing the pieces to slide against each other and reveal the “blades” of the ninja star. Do this until the hole in the center is closed and all 8 edges of the ninja star are revealed. This is the transformed state of the ninja star.

steps.title: Pull outward on two opposite pieces until it is reverted to its original untransformed state.
steps.content: Pull outward on two opposite pieces until it is reverted to its original untransformed state. Repeat the above step to transform the Ninja Star again, and repeat.
